trans-unit.source: The `CMFCColorBar` class represents a docking control bar that can select colors in a document or application.
Calculates the vertical and horizontal margins that are required to contain the buttons on the color bar control and then adjusts the location of those buttons.
Creates a color bar control window, attaches it to the `CMFCColorBar` object, and resizes the control to contain the specified palette of colors.
Creates a color bar control window and attaches it to the `CMFCColorBar` object.
Shows or hides the automatic button.
Enables or disables the display of a dialog box that lets the user select more colors.
Retrieves the command ID of the current color bar control.
Retrieves the color that signifies that a color button has the focus; that is, the button is *hot*.
Retrieves the horizontal margin, which is the space between the left or right color cell and the client area boundary.
Retrieves the vertical margin, which is the space between the top or bottom color cell and the client area boundary.
Indicates whether the current color bar is dockable.
Sets the color that is currently selected.
Sets a new name for a specified color.
Sets a new command ID for a color bar control.
Sets the list of colors that are used in the current document.
Sets the horizontal margin, which is the space between the left or right color cell and the client area boundary.
Sets the vertical margin, which is the space between the top or bottom color cell and the client area boundary.
Adjusts the positions of the color buttons on the color bar control.
Indicates whether the text label of color buttons can change.
Indicates whether the color bar control object can appear in a toolbar list during the customization process.
Called by the framework as part of the layout calculation process.
Initalizes a palette with the colors in a specified array of colors.
Calculates the number of rows and columns in the grid of a color bar control.
Calculates the additional height that the current color bar requires to display miscellaneous user interface elements such as the **Other** button, document colors, and so on.
Initializes an array of colors with the colors in a specified palette or the system default palette.
Called by the framework when a user presses a keyboard button.
Called by the framework to close a hierarchy of popup controls.
Called by the framework to enable or disable a user-interface item of a color bar control before the item is displayed.
Completely redraws the color bar control.
Sets the logical palette of the specified device context to the palette of the parent button of the current color bar control.
Sets the `m_pWndPropList` protected data member to the specified pointer to a property grid control.
Requests the frame window that owns the color bar control to update the message line in the status bar.
A Boolean field that determines whether mouse events are processed.
Typically, mouse events are processed when this field is `TRUE` and customization mode is `FALSE`.
A Boolean that indicates whether a control is enabled.
A Boolean that indicates whether the color bar control supports docking.
A [CSize](../../atl-mfc-shared/reference/csize-class.md) object that specifies the size of a cell in a color bar grid.
A Boolean that indicates whether to show document colors when the color bar is docked.
A Boolean that indicates whether to show the standard system color dialog box or the [CMFCColorDialog](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolordialog-class.md) dialog box.
A [COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183449) that stores the current automatic color.
An [CMap](../../mfc/reference/cmap-class.md) object that associates a set of RGB colors with their names.
A [CArray](../../mfc/reference/carray-class.md) of [COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183449) values that contains the colors that are displayed in the color bar control.
A [COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183449) value that is the color that the user has currently selected from the color bar control.
A [CList](../../mfc/reference/clist-class.md) of [COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd183449) values that contains the colors that are currently used in a document.
An unsigned integer that is the command ID of a color button.
An integer that is the horizontal margin between the color buttons in a grid of colors.
An integer that is the horizontal offset to the center of the color button.
This value is significant if the button displays text or an image in addition to a color.
An integer that is the number of columns in a color bar control grid of colors.
An integer that is the number of columns in a vertically oriented grid of colors.
An integer that is the number of columns in a horizontally oriented grid of colors.
An integer that is the height of a row of color buttons in a grid of colors.
An integer that is the vertical margin between the color buttons in a grid of colors.
An integer that is the vertical offset to the center of the color button.
This value is significant if the button displays text or an image in addition to a color.
A [CPalette](../../mfc/reference/cpalette-class.md) of the colors that are used in the color bar control.
A pointer to a [CMFCColorButton](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolorbutton-class.md) object that is the parent of the current button.
This value is significant if the color button is in a hierarchy of toolbar controls or is in a color property grid control.
A pointer to a [CMFCRibbonColorButton](../../mfc/reference/cmfcribboncolorbutton-class.md) object that is on the ribbon and is the parent button of the current button.
This value is significant if the color button is in a hierarchy of toolbar controls or is in a color property grid control.
A [CString](../../atl-mfc-shared/reference/cstringt-class.md) that is the text that is displayed on the **Automatic** button.
A [CString](../../atl-mfc-shared/reference/cstringt-class.md) that is the text that is displayed on the document colors button.
A [CString](../../atl-mfc-shared/reference/cstringt-class.md) that is the text that is displayed on the *other* button.
Usually, you do not create a `CMFCColorBar` object directly.

Instead, the [CMFCColorMenuButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolormenubutton-class.md) (used in menus and toolbars) or the [CMFCColorButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolorbutton-class.md) creates the `CMFCColorBar` object.
The `CMFCColorBar` class provides the following functionality:
Automatically adjusts the list of document colors.
Saves and restores its state, together with the document state.
Uses the [CMFCColorPickerCtrl Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolorpickerctrl-class.md) control to select a custom color.
Supports a "tear-off" state (if it is created by using the [CMFCColorMenuButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolormenubutton-class.md)).
To incorporate the `CMFCColorBar` functionality into your application:
Create a regular menu button and assign it an ID, for example ID_CHAR_COLOR.

In your frame window class, override the [CFrameWndEx::OnShowPopupMenu](../../mfc/reference/cframewndex-class.md#cframewndex__onshowpopupmenu) method and replace the regular menu button with a [CMFCColorMenuButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolormenubutton-class.md) object (by calling [CMFCToolBar::ReplaceButton](../../mfc/reference/cmfctoolbar-class.md#cmfctoolbar__replacebutton)).
Set all the styles and enable or disable the features of the `CMFCColorBar` object during [CMFCColorMenuButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolormenubutton-class.md) creation.
The `CMFCColorMenuButton` object dynamically creates the `CMFCColorBar` object after the framework calls the `CreatePopupMenu` method.
When the user clicks a color bar control button, the framework uses the `ON_COMMAND` macro to notify the parent of the color bar control.
In the macro, the command ID parameter is the value that you assigned to the color bar control button in step 1 (ID_CHAR_COLOR in this example).

For more information, see the [CMFCColorMenuButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolormenubutton-class.md), [CMFCColorButton Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolorbutton-class.md), [CMFCColorPickerCtrl Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolorpickerctrl-class.md), [CFrameWndEx Class](../../mfc/reference/cframewndex-class.md), and [CMFCToolBar Class](../../mfc/reference/cmfctoolbar-class.md) classes.
The following example demonstrates how to configure a color bar by using various methods in the `CMFCColorBar` class.
The methods set the horizontal and vertical margins, enable the other button, create a color bar control window, and sets the currently selected color.
This example is part of the [New Controls sample](../../visual-cpp-samples.md).
Adjusts the positions of the color buttons on the color bar control.
This method is called by the framework during `WM_SIZE` message processing.
Indicates whether the text label of color buttons can change.
By default, this method always returns `FALSE`, which means text labels cannot be modified.
Override this method to enable modifying text labels.
Indicates whether the color bar control object can appear in a toolbar list during the customization process.
By default, this method always returns `TRUE`, which means the framework can display the color bar control during the customization process.
Override this method to implement a different behavior.
Called by the framework as part of the layout calculation process.
to specify that the color bar control is docked vertically; `FALSE` to specify that the color bar control is docked horizontally.
The size of the array of color buttons in a color bar control.
An array of colors that the framework displays on the color bar control.
The text label of the *automatic* (default) color button, or `NULL`.
The standard label for the automatic button is **Automatic**.
The text label of the *other* button, which displays more color choices, or `NULL`.
The standard label for the other button is **More Colors...**.
The text label of the document colors button.
The document colors palette lists all the colors that the document currently uses.
A list of colors that the document currently uses.
The number of columns that the array of colors has.
The number of rows that the color bar has when it is docked horizontally.
The number of columns that the color bar has when it is docked vertically.
The default color that the framework applies when you click the automatic button.
The color bar control command ID.
A pointer to a parent button.
An existing `CMFCColorBar` object to be copied into the new `CMFCColorBar` object.
Calculates the vertical and horizontal margins that are required to contain the buttons on the color bar control, and adjusts the location of those buttons.
to specify that the shape of the buttons on a color bar control are square; otherwise, `FALSE`.
to specify that the content on the face of a color bar control button is centered; otherwise, `FALSE`.
Creates a color bar control window and attaches it to the `CMFCColorBar` object.
Pointer to a palette of colors.
The number of columns in the color bar control.
The number of rows in the color bar control when it is docked horizontally.
The number of columns in the color bar control when it is docked vertically.
if this method is successful; otherwise, `FALSE`.
To construct a `CMFCColorBar` object, call the class constructor then this method.
The `Create` method creates the Windows control and initializes a list of colors.
Creates a color bar control window, attaches it to the `CMFCColorBar` object, and resizes the control window to contain the specified palette of colors.
A bounding rectangle that specifies where to draw the color bar control.
The ideal number of columns in the color bar control.
This method modifies that number to fit the specified palette of colors.
The default is -1, which means this parameter is not specified.
Pointer to a palette of colors, or `NULL`.
If this parameter is `NULL`, this method calculates the size of the color bar control as if 20 colors were specified.

This method uses the `rect`, `nColumns`, and `pPalette` parameters to calculate the appropriate number or rows and columns in the color bar control, and then calls the [CMFCColorBar::Create](#cmfccolorbar__create) method.
Initializes a palette with the colors in a specified array of colors.
if this method is successful; otherwise, `FALSE`.
Shows or hides the automatic button.
The text label of the *automatic* (default) color button, or `NULL`.
The standard label for the automatic button is **Automatic**.
The default color that the framework applies when you click the automatic button.
to enable the automatic button; `FALSE` to disable the automatic button.
The text label of the automatic button is deleted if the `lpszLabel` parameter is `NULL` or the `bEnable` parameter is `FALSE`.
Enables or disables the display of a dialog box that lets the user select more colors.
The text label of the *other* button, which displays more color choices, or `NULL`.
The standard label for this button is **More Colors...**.
to display the [CMFCColorDialog](../../mfc/reference/cmfccolordialog-class.md) dialog box; `FALSE` to display the standard [CColorDialog](../../mfc/reference/ccolordialog-class.md) dialog box.
to enable the button; `FALSE` to disable the button.
Calculates the number of rows and columns in the grid of a color bar control.
to perform the calculation for a vertically docked color bar control; otherwise, perform the calculation for a horizontally docked control.
A [CSize](../../atl-mfc-shared/reference/csize-class.md) object whose `cx` component contains the number of columns and whose `cy` component contains the number of rows.
Retrieves the command ID of the current color bar control.
When the user selects a new color, the framework sends the command ID in a `WM_COMMAND` message to notify the parent of the `CMFCColorBar` object.
Calculates the additional height that the current color bar requires to display miscellaneous user interface elements, such as the **Other** button or document colors.
If the color bar control contains document colors, the number of columns to display in the grid of document colors.
Otherwise, this value is not used.
The calculated extra height that is required.
Retrieves the color that signifies that a color button has the focus; that is, the button is *hot*.
Retrieves the horizontal margin, which is the space between the left or right color cell and the client area boundary.
Retrieves the vertical margin, which is the space between the top or bottom color cell and the client area boundary.
Initializes an array of colors with the colors in a specified palette, or with the system default palette.
A pointer to a palette object, or `NULL`.
If this parameter is `NULL`, this method uses the default palette of the operating system.
The number of elements in the array of colors.
Indicates whether the current color bar is dockable.
if the current color bar control is dockable; otherwise, `FALSE`.
If the color bar control is dockable, it can be torn off a control bar and docked at another location.
Called by the framework when a user presses a keyboard button.
The virtual-key code for the key that a user pressed.
if this method processes the specified key; otherwise, `FALSE`.
Called by the framework to close a hierarchy of pop-up controls.
Pointer to a control that resides on a toolbar.
if this method is successful; otherwise, `FALSE`.
Called by the framework to enable or disable a user-interface item of a color bar control before the item is displayed.
Pointer to a window that contains a user-interface item to update.
to disable the user-interface item if no handler is defined in a message map; otherwise, `FALSE`.
When a user of your application clicks a user-interface item, the item must know whether it should be displayed as enabled or disabled.
The target of the command message provides this information by implementing an `ON_UPDATE_COMMAND_UI` command handler.
Use this method to help process the command.
The color that is selected by default when the color dialog box opens.
The color that a user selected.
if the user selected a color; `FALSE` if the user canceled the color dialog box.
Completely redraws the color bar control.
Sets the logical palette of the specified device context to the palette of the parent button of the current color bar control.
Pointer to the device context of the parent button of the current color bar control.
Pointer to the palette that is replaced by the palette of the parent button of the current color bar control.
Sets the color that is currently selected.
Sets a new name for a specified color.
The RGB value of a color.
The new name for the specified color.
This method changes the name of the specified color in all `CMFCColorBar` objects in your application.
Sets a new command ID for a color bar control.
Call this method to modify the command ID of a color bar control and to notify the parent window of the control that the ID has changed.
Sets the list of colors that are used in the current document.
A caption that is displayed when the color bar control is not docked.
A list of colors that replaces the current document colors.
to show document colors when the color bar control is docked; otherwise, `FALSE`.
*Document colors* are the colors that are currently used in a document.
The framework automatically maintains a list of document colors, but you can use this method to modify the list.
Sets the horizontal margin, which is the space between the left or right color cell and the boundary of the client area.
By default, the [CMFCColorBar::CMFCColorBar](#cmfccolorbar__cmfccolorbar) constructor sets the horizontal margin to 4 pixels.
Sets the `m_pWndPropList` protected data member to the specified pointer to a property grid control.
Pointer to property grid control object.
Sets the vertical margin, which is the space between the top or bottom color cell and the client area boundary.
By default, the [CMFCColorBar::CMFCColorBar](#cmfccolorbar__cmfccolorbar) constructor sets the vertical margin to 4 pixels.
Requests the frame window that owns the color bar control to update the message line in the status bar.
This method sends the `WM_SETMESSAGESTRING` message to the owner of the color bar control.
